Name: Register Interface Allows Software Access to Sensitive Data or Security Settings
Description: Memory-mapped registers provide access to hardware functionality from software and if not properly secured can result in loss of confidentiality and integrity.
ExtendedDescription: It is common for software to access peripherals in an SoC through a memory-mapped register interface.  Any security-critical data accessible directly or indirectly through the register interface must have a clearly defined access control policy which is correctly implemented to protect assets in the hardware design from software.
